toc_entry.title: What Do Deer Hunters Really Want?
toc_entry.description: Deer hunting in Texas is a passion, and meat for the freezer is far from the only motive.

toc_entry.title: The Book Of the Century-And-A-Half
toc_entry.description: Governor Bill Clements lassoed James Michener to write a tome about Texas. It’s due out in a couple of years. But that’s too long to wait, so we decided to write a version of our own.

toc_entry.title: Way Out West In the Land Of Cotton
toc_entry.description: People still think of cotton as a Dixieland crop, but the heart of the nation’s production is on the dry, flat, and windswept High Plains of Texas.

toc_entry.title: The Beer That Made Armadillos Famous
toc_entry.description: For years no one would drink Lone Star beer because rednecks did; then one enterprising man figured out that if it was marketed right, everyone would want to drink Lone Star precisely because rednecks did.

toc_entry.title: The Hughes Drill Bit
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: This clunky piece of machinery made Howard Hughes very rich. It is the first in our series of things that every Texan should know.

toc_entry.title: Waiting For Mommy
toc_entry.description: If you leave your child at a day care center, you are hardly unique. If you know what your child does there all day, you are indeed unique.

toc_entry.title: Little Oil
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: Big Oil no longer holds political sway in Washington, and wildcatters are celebrating a new Texas independents’ day.

toc_entry.title: I Was a Hostess At a Tupperware Party
toc_entry.subtitle: Lifestyles
toc_entry.description: All the carefree young bachelor wanted was a few pieces of Tupperware. He never dreamed what he’d have to go through to get it.

toc_entry.title: Burnet’s Milestone
toc_entry.subtitle: architecture
toc_entry.description: A winning design for the Burnet Civic Center shows why regionalist architecture is still going strong in rural Texas.

toc_entry.title: The Stuff That Dreams Are Made Of
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: In Pennies From Heaven Steve Martin gets serious, which is too bad—until he jumps into his dazzling dance numbers, which are too good to be true. Four Friends is about pals, and it palls. In Sharky’s Machine Burt Reynolds tries to mix gore with mush. Rollover defaults.

toc_entry.title: The Lord Giveth And the Lord Giveth
toc_entry.subtitle: Church
toc_entry.description: Evangelist Kenneth Copeland has good news: the faithful don’t have to wait for heaven to reap their rewards. An Eastern Orthodox congregation in austin is strict about performance of the liturgy but lax about getting to the church on time.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: Out on the outskirts of town.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Over the river and through the swamp.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Twixt the cup and the lipstick.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to entertainment and events of more than usual interest.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: A lawyer takes aim at handgun makers; Texas journalism gets high on society; politicians see red over fire ants; Dallas tries to master its aversion to master plans.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Selling the streets of Laredo; the next big oil play; the bar breaks up over a Supreme Court race; it’s true what they say about office Christmas parties.
